text: Kapuiviit (Inuktitut syllabics: ᑲᐳᐃᕖᑦKapuiviit) formerly Jens Munk Island,Kapuiviit (Formerly Jens Munk Island) for Dano-Norwegian explorer Jens Munk, is one of the Canadian arctic islands in the Qikiqtaaluk Region, Nunavut, Canada. It is an uninhabited Baffin Island offshore island. Located at 69°39'N 80°04'W it has an area of . The island presently has no permanent resident population. Historically, however, it was the location of Kapuivik, a hunting camp which is now an important archaeological site for Dorset and Pre- Dorset research.Peter N. Peregrine and Melvin Ember, Encyclopedia of Prehistory: Volume 2: Arctic and Subarctic, Volume 6. Springer Science+Business Media, 2001. . p. 41. Kapuivik was also the birthplace of noted film director Zacharias Kunuk."Zacharias Kunuk’s life, from a sod house to the Cannes Film Festival". Toronto Star, April 26, 2015. ==References== Category:Islands of Foxe Basin Category:Islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago
title: Kapuiviit
